{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3553726,"name":"Leo Phan","username":"richardcarlsonjrthe3","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/5daacb/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T04:26:45.614Z","cooked":"

Im having a hard time trying to figure out the frame perimeter for this robot.
Here is the website statements:

I’m confused about the frame perimeter, though. The 33"x49" perimeter is illegal as the maximum frame perimeter for 2016 was 120in. So I assumed it was 2W*2L. I put it into CAD and also took the 4 8" wheels and found out it doesn’t match up. This picture:

image1101×847 132 KB

Indicates that the frame goes beyond the 4 wheels. However, the CAD:
image1052×613 51.1 KB

Shows that it doesn’t as 24.5 is less than 32, so it wouldn’t work, and yada yada. I’m just trying to understand what the perimeter is. The ABS belly pan also doesn’t match up with any of the perimeters. Any help on digesting and figuring this out would be appreciated. Also, how can I elevate the bumper mount to be above the wheels? I’m planning on just using a 2x1 and putting on a gusset or something.
Here is the website and stuff:
https://www.team254.com/first/2016/

media.team254.com

97d107e6-technicalBinder2016.pdf

3.75 MB

Original plan was to find a legal frame perimeter for the 2016 game, I did actually find it, I don’t know how I missed it the first time but I made a legal one

I think by “size” it means the end-to-end dimensions in each direction when mechanisms are extended (without the climber, as the height would be bigger).
